alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 8:21PM MST until September 13 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING NEAR MIDDLE VERDE IN YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 818 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that rainfall intensity has decreased, with some moderate rain continuing. Very heavy rain fell earlier this evening just north of Highway 260 between Verde Village and Middle Verde. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell, and flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jordan, Hayfield Draw OHV Area, Middle Verde, and far south end of Cottonwood. This includes State Route 260 between mile markers 209 and 214. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Beaver Creek, Cherry Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Oak Creek and Verde River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
